snippet: The Brooklyn neighborhood, once stigmatized by violence and segregation, is now luring young people and new businesses, but some longtime residents are not sure the change is good.
abstract: Franklin Avenue in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn has seen an influx of young professionals, families and entrepreneurs transform it from a dilapidated commercial strip to a stylish neighborhood and entertainment destination; beneath the pulsing energy, however, is an undercurrent of unease, with many long-time residents expressing fears that the demographic change will ultimately price them out and force them to move.
lead_paragraph: The Brooklyn neighborhood, once stigmatized by violence and segregation, is now luring young people and new businesses, but some longtime residents are not sure the change is good.

headline.seo: In Crown Heights, a Renaissance With Unease
headline.main: Unease Lingers Amid a Rebirth in Crown Heights
headline.print_headline: Unease Lingers Amid a Rebirth In Crown Heights
